content: That's a store I would love to work on, Good people, good music, good acting. Allan Moyle did a great job!!. The scenes are real funny, specially the great performance of Anthony LaPaglia, Rory Cochrane and Johnny Whitworth playng  "If you want blood you've got it", Lucas is a great character, Mark is one of the most funny guys I ever saw,and have you ever see two girls more beautiful than Liv Tyler and Renée Zellweger? For the rock lovers like me this movie is the heaven.

title: trendy garbage
content: I cant believe people like this movie. This is a ripoff of Dazed and Confused and John Hughes. It shows the trials and tribulations along with the hardships of working in a record store. It is totally unrealistic and should be banned. All of the actors look like they are bored to death. I know that some of the actors have talent, with the exception of Ethan Embry but this is an embarrassment. It's only redeeming value is a cameo by Gwar and a cast of beautiful women. Too bad having gorgeous women cant save a movie. Teen dreck. Zero stars

title: EMPIRE RECORDS a Teen Trash Classic
content: In reality, this movie really stinks. It's obviously rushed, not well thought out, and reeks of mid-90's alt-slacker non-revolution. Yet it's totally interesting from a cinematic standpoint as we watch Allan Moyle cannibalize the themes from his previous teen pictures into one big ball of overly-romantic teen angst. It's compulsively watchable and highly embarrassing at the same time; you wouldn't want to be caught watching it by your friends. Everybody in this film seems to be having a good time making it and that vibe is infectious. It also gets better with repeated viewings. Go figure.

title: lovable, enjoyable, hilarious
content: First off, I'm a 21 year-old, so when this movie came out, it was smack targeted at my age-group, which in fact, should've ended(probably did) that 'target'with people in their mid-twenties.The one bad thing I have to say is...sorry, but, I'm one of the few people who don't like Liv Tyler. Guys, I tried. Maybe someday, I will, but it hasn't gotten to that stage yet. this means that, to me, anybody could've played the part of "Cory". But this leads me to the next good thing about this movie.See, Allan Moyle just uses actors as pions to the mood he wants to invoke. It doesn't mean that all his characters are realistic, but many times, they are. For example, the typical, "lost soul" kind of girl who can't find her mom, treats people like garbage, and tries to commit suicide, is cliche because it's been covered countless times in the past. But the attitude it gives us about her, almost like, 'if you don't just think about yourself, and get some humor into your life, pieces will come together' is strikingly original. Same with the other characters. I'm sure you already knows that this is directed by Allan Moyle, same guy who directed "Pump Up The Volume." You can sense the similarities, one of them being the cool effects that peer togetherness/pressure can bring, in Pump Up The Volume it was Slater's fans, in this flick, towards the end, all the young peers who have probably only HEARD of how cool Empire Records is, go there and raise money and help it out. In short, this is done to create Empire Records as a cult hit.Okay, now cool quotes."Lucas, where's the money?" Joe, the money is gone. "Where's it gone to?" "U-h-h...Atlantic City." "Really. What's it DOING in Atlantic City?!" "...recirculating?" "Lucas-" "Joe" Lucas-""Joe" (then, about the owner) "Lucas, I told Mitchell, you forgot to deposit the money. I told him it was still in the safe!" "Joe that's not true, it's in Atlantic City...I swear!"and then, when Empire Records is about to become Music Town, Gina (Renee Zellweger) and Debra(the "lost soul" girl) are reading the rulesDeb- "no tattoos or piercing." Gina- "No revealing clothing." D- "we're both screwed. At least you're used to it. G-0h, Deb. Don't be bitter. I'm sure with your ever growing collection of flesh-mutilating appendages and your new Neo-Nazi bootcamp makeover, the boys'll come-a-runnin'. D- "Let's not fight, let's just rip."And don't even get me started on the soundtrack!!5 out of 4 starsSee it now! Please.

title: Best Movie
content: Okay for you silly people you hate this movie what is wrong with you?!?! This is one of the best movies I have ever seen. A bunch of misfits working in a record shop. It is full of energy and each character has its own problem. It is so good!!!

title: Where's the Advil?
content: I cannot remember a movie that has given me such a headache.  I sat there for about a minute as the credits rolled, wondering what on earth had driven me to renting this movie.  Why does everyone have a problem?  Why is everyone so unrealistic?  Is it possible Mark is the most annoying character of any film of the 90s?  I don't know the answer to the first two questions, but I'd say the answer to the last is that he's at least in the top five.

title: Music and Teen Angst
content: While this movie is one definatley worth watching, there are still certain aspects of it that make me cringe. First of all the casting of Johnny Whitworth as AJ was a terrible decision. This character was supposed to be intresting and deep. However by casting a pretty boy I found my self hating this character. If this movie was made ten years ealrier John Cusak would have played AJ, of course because of the music it would have been a entriely different film.As much as I hated Johnny Whitmore I did think that Anthony Lapalglia was great as Joe. Joe was supposed to be like that groovy guidance counselor in high school who was always there to look out for you. Lapaglia plays this character just right. There is no doubt that this material is below him but he handles it very well.Some of the other memembers of this cast are also entertaining to watch. Another good performance comes from Rory Cochrane as Lucas, the philospher and smart ass of the group. Also this film features a pre-Jerry Maquire Rene Zellwegaras the slutty Gina.The story it's self is nothing really revoluntionary. A group of mistfits work in a record store that is going to be made into a Sam Goody type outlet store very soon and all the freedom their cool, hip boss, Joe has provided them will be gone. Oh and there is the girl dealing with suicide, heart ache, and ultimatley love growing from heart ache. At certain points in this film it seems like it is trying to be a 90's take of Dazed and Confused. Dealing with teen issue while packing the movie full of period music and colorful characters. However, rest assure it is no Dazed and ConfusedThe rest of the movie is just alright. It is a good movie to catch on VH1 every once and awhile or even rent when you can't think of anything else. For me the film's soundtrack brought me back to the good ole' days of 1995. Coming home from the 7th grade turing on the radio while doing homework and listening to the Gin BlossomsCatch the movie if it is on or rent it when you got nothing else to see, it's good for that.

title: the greatest flick ever
content: this movie is the funniest most lightheartedly enjoyable movies to watch. The stereotypes are well pulled off, Liv Tyler and Renee' Zelweger especially. It pulls the best lines, has great moments, and is very quotable. Kickass music helps too. A must watch!

title: Rock & Roll,Rebellion against authority and finding yourself all rolled into one great movie!
content: Empire Records has something for people of all ages.Great tunes,killer cast,you can't lose!

title: "I wonder if I'll be held responsible for this?"
content: What a film. It doesn't make the mistake of other teen hits, by trying to be deep and meaningful. It's about being young, having fun, and living life. If you don't find yourself quoting from this film after the first viewing, something's wrong. If you don't know the entire script after the second or third, something's seriously wrong. And if you don't bother watching it at least once a week, then you're far too busy for your own good.The cast all give great performances, but this isn't a film which is open to dissection. It has one soul (typo intended!) purpose - enjoyment. Well maybe two if you count the feel-good factor. And don't get me started on the soundtrack. Really. Don't just rent it. Buy it, own it, and watch it over and over and over.....8/10

title: A little noticed, but excellent scene.
content: In "Empire Records", many of the scenes seemed to focus on only the main characters.Fortunately for me, there was a personally favorite scene, where Mark tries to kiss the ballerina (Melissa Caulfield). When he can't quite go through with it, he plays along in an exuberant mood as the ballerina begins to dance, dusting off her broken foot, and sharing a smile understood by both.

title: Tries so hard that it fails...
content: I saw this movie when I was a teen (late teens) but did not feel that it "spoke" to me.  There are a lot of coming of age, comedy-dramas that really identify with their core viewers but this was not one of them.  Over-acting and ridiculously obvious characters kept it from becoming the feel-good movie of the year.  It's not a waste of time however, a lot of my friends enjoyed it, there are some good laughs and eye-candy. But if you want to laugh or feel heard as an angst-ridden teen I suggest: Animal House, With Honors, Pump Up the Volume or Ferris Bueller's Day off (Cameron provides the reality :)

title: Typical Teenage Movie
content: This is a good movie for those who are interested in mindless comedy. This is your typical X-Genereation movie.  In a time with nothing to fight for or nothing to beleive in teenagers turn to the only thing they can recognize. A music store run by an old hippie who  never bothered to grow up.  It deals with the things a new generation fights everyday.  I highly suggest this movie for everyone.  Just don't look for deep meaning or plot.  It isn't there but today there's deep left anymore.

title: bizarre
content: This really is a bizarre beast of a movie.  some aspects of it are really really good, and others really really bad. It certainly gives the impression that the script aimed higher than tacky happy comedy, but the director/production company didn't. A friend of mine forced it on me as a tacky happy, but quite frankly, when one of the main characters tries to top herself, and cuts her hair off for attention then it really isn't all fun and games. It's worth watching, if only to appreciate the movie that it wanted to be, even if it didn't quite have the balls to be it. Definitely a good argument that scriptwriters should just to direct their own scripts.

title: A kind of dumb music movie that takes itself 2 seriously
content: An independant music company called Empire Records is threatened to be changed into another music place. It's like a way stupider version of Barbershop with a record store. The unmemorable charectors include a speed fanatic, a hash brownie junkee, a girl who just likes to have fun, a compelte nerd, a gothic girl considering suicide and more. Another thing that sucks about this movie is that it thinks of itself as being serious. It's not. Ok for an undemanding friday night. Starring Liv Tyler, Ethan Embry, Renee Zellweger, and others. Rated PG-13 for language, some sexual situations, and frequent drug use and issues.

title: Among the Best
content: Empire Records is among the best of the teenage movies.  It's realism and true-to-life situations allow people to relate.  It may be true that Ebert said it was just a bunch of teens dancing and goofing off...but what's wrong with that??  Empire was packed full of pumpin' music and stereotypical characters, but also amazing actors and a unique style that will never be recaptured.  Lucas' odd philosophy, A.J.'s art,  Mark's brownies, Gina's ambitions, Corey's little blue skirt, and  Deb's neo-nazi boot camp makeover make movie fans come a-runnin' to the best movie I've have ever seen.

title: Pretty Good Movie
content: I just rented this movie.  I really enjoyed this movie and I'm glad that I rented it.  There were only a few parts in this movie that were a little weird and of course you know that it's one of those mid 90's movies so it's gotta be weird.  But overall this movie is definately worth renting.  If your like me than even if you just liked one part of Empire Records than you will probably buy it. I would give it a 9/10

title: Great film.
content: Empire Records is a great movie. It shows teenagers dealing with what teenagers deal with: love, sex, and work. Older people who have forgotten what it's like to be a teen won't like it, but younger people will love it.

title: characters and dialogue make this a great film
content: Remember your favourite movie as a kid?  The one everyone else said was junk?  This is another one of those little, charming gems some will cherish. Empire Records makes up for a too-neat ending by combining memorable characters and smart, snappy dialogue.

title: amazing.
content: God, this movie is brilliant. A lot of you are missing the point - it's not SUPPOSED to be one of those movies with a good plot that you have to follow, its just a great fun film to watch whenever. Great soundtrack, amazing performances by Ethan Embry(credited as Ethan Randall) and the rest of the cast as well.500/10 stars. if you haven't seen it, you must. title: worthwhile experience
content: what a great movie! what else is a better job than working in a record store? (everyone, at one time in their life, has wanted to work in a record store.--i know i have [and still want to!]) thumbs up, great fun for everyone!

title: Should be crap
content: Yeah. This is one of those films that really SHOULD be crap. It's cheesy, far-fetched, very stupid and over the top. But's it's also lovable for all it's faults. It's an enjoyable easy-on-the-brain movie, with cool music and cute people. I like it a lot. Sort of Dazed And Confused-lite.

title: The fat man walks alone
content: This movie has long been a favorite of mine.  I love how the different personality types come together like one big dysfunctional family. Reminds me of family functions from the past.Watching the trailer on the DVD makes me wish for a DVD extra of deleted scenes.

title: The Best of The Best In My Book
content: This is my favorite movie...I've seen it at least once a week since I first saw it about 2 years ago...a fun flick to watch, complete with comedy and sensitivity...addresses a few real life issues! Check it out...If you're an "Empire Lover" write me and let me know...If you've never seen it, check it out...

title: My favorite movie of all time.
content: I was introduced to this movie about a year back and ever since then i have been obsessed with it.  i know every word to it.  and the thing is, is that it is just a really fun movie, it doesn't go too deep and yet at the same time its not a completely petty and retarded movie to watch.  it really lets you know how much your world can turn around in just a little while. especially when its on "Rex Manning Day".  My two fave characters were Warren and Mark, because they are so much like my friends and they were deep, maybe you have to watch it a couple of times to really see it but they are. there are hidden meanings all over the place you just have to be looking for them. i definetly recommend this movie.

title: Amazing, I couldn't have done better myself.....
content: Wow, oh wow was that an amazing movie. Frankly I wasn't really interested in seeing it, 'cause it looked like a stupid-teeny- bopper-type of flick. But instead I was blown away by the clever writing and great acting.I'm extremely impressed with the amount of talent all the young actors seemed to possess. Ethan Embry and Renee Zellweger were especially talented. I hope to see future movies like this one and I hope others discover this great flick.

title: Misfits, Great Music, Great Characters
content: Empire records has a great story about a bunch of misfits who work and run an independent Record Store.  The Movie is about one day at the record store where all hell breaks lose and all the misfits seem to find out something about them selves individually.  The Music is great, really helps to move the story.  You can tell the cast loved making this movie, all the character get to go wild, and scream to the camera their characters personality. Non Stop, not one moment will this movie lose your attention.It the place you wished that you once had a chance to work!

title: High Fidelity was a great film
content: As a one time record store employee (Sam the Record Man in downtown Vancouver for those of you who were wondering) one of the many things I loved about "High Fidelity" was that people stopped comparing my store to "Empire Records". "Emp. Rec" was dumb, even by teen movie standards. And the soundtrack? This movie was obviously made by people who hate music.

title: empire rancid
content: i understand that this movie has a lot of cult fanatics, and perhaps, if i was a bored, angst ridden teen with zero exposure to any other half decent film in 1995 (i was 22), i woulda loved it, but as it stands, i have a certain degree of taste and have seen several films, and i like to think i know what constitues good cinema, and this was far far far from good cinema. it was very self-consciously "cute", and self-congratulatory.  it was virtually plotless, felt like a sitcom, with one dimensional characters and tedious dance sequences to bad grungy mid-nineties rock.  it suddenly hit me that i was wasting my time watching this flick, so i promptly shut it off two thirds of the way in.  it was so smarmy and bland and the characters were so, "lookit me, ma, i'm hip".  i was really annoyed.  the rex character was interesting, and the bald chick had potential, but that's as far as it goes, really.  i agree with the others.  watch high fidelity, which is far more clever and interesting and well made.  it comes closer to art than this piece of bland mass entertainment.  i couldn't begin to describe the problems with this.  all i can really say is that the girl who lent this to me says it's her favourite movie and was insulted that i shut it off.  she also didn't appreciate "my night at maud's" (french intelligent filmmaking at it's close to finest).  what can i say.  different strokes for different folks.

title: definitely in my top 5
content: Apart from the soundtrack being totally kick-butt, which it is, I really think that Empire is really like a High Fidelity for a younger audience. Both movies have just awesome soundtracks, both deal with love (Empire has it as a subplot, yes, but it's still there) and both don't get caught up with all the pompousness of 20-million-dollar-a-movie actors.Empire Records is a must see, don't even bother renting it, just buy the thing :) ****1/2

title: go rent it!
content: I really like this movie because aside from the good looking cast of hot men and gorgeous women (Anthony La Paglia, Maxwell Caufield, Liv Tyler)it was really funny. Could do with a little work in the cohesive plot department (High Fidelity did it better)but generally has enough mix of humour and issues. Also look for Renee Zelwegger before she got all Hollywood playing loveable but a little easy Gina.A good movie. Go see it so you can understand all those jokes about it.

title: good if you like teen movies
content: This is basically a teen movie to the nth degree. Cliched characters, dodgy plot, cod philosophy, some romance, a few drugs, and a nice happy ending. If you hate teen movies, avoid it like the plague. But if you just want a couple of hours of mindless fun, it's a good film.

title: a 90 minute music video
content: a great cast is pretty much wasted in this 90 minute music video.good music is just about the only thing good about this movie.i love teen movies.but you need more than just great music in a teen movie.the soundtrack is really good,but far from being the best ever.this movie was all in all ok.but empire records is just another teen movie in the 90's trying to be as good as a lot of 80's teen movies.but there are some in the 90's that are as good as some in the 80's.empire records is not one of them.it's another breakfast club wannabe.i give empire records ** out of ****

title: Say no more...
content: If you've seen the trailer for this, forget all about it. Please. The trailer looked awful. But this movie is amazing. One day in the life of several teenagers who work at a record store. Simple, but genius. There IS a love story to this, but seriously it takes up five minutes of the movie. No more. This movie deals with many aspects of teenage life in general. There's the Teen Angst girl who cuts her wrists and shaves her head because she's feeling invisible (and there's one of them in every school), the "perfect" girl, who it turns out isn't really so perfect after all, the slut -I'm sure we all know a few of them- who turns out just to be confused and scared of growing up, the guy who's not sure what he wants to do now he's leaving school, the teen criminal (I won't even tell you how he ends up), and the screwball who's on a permanent sugar high, but we love him anyway. It deals with issues like sex, drugs, moving on, change, depression, and of course just a little love. The songs in this are perfect (although the best ones for some reason aren't on the CD) and just make you wanna jump up and dance! 10/10

title: The greatest teen flick of the nineties!
content: One of my favorite movies of all time, Empire Records is great fun from start to finish.  With a fabulous soundtrack and a talented cast, Empire Records is the story of a group of teenagers who work in a record store. When they find out that the store is about to be taken over by the Music Town franchise, they come together to save Empire Records.Empire Records has tons of laughs, interesting characters, rock 'n' roll, a vain music star and some great dance numbers, with a little romance thrown in for good measure.Enjoy!

title: What Teen Movies Should Strive To Be
content: This movie is good.  Admittedly, it could've been better, but it's good. Unlike such other teen comedies such as Ten Things I Hate About You (which was really funnier than this movie) and Can't Hardly Wait (which was really a lot worse than this movie), it didn't have that make-ya-wanna-vomit "I'm in love with you but you tell me that you don't love me at first but at the end you realize that you really do love me and we make-out" plot.  Well actually it does, but at least this time it's just a 5 minute insignificant subplot (really, just 5 minutes).  What's good about this movie is that it doesn't try to have a deep plot, unlike other teen disasters (i.e. Suburbia).  This is a movie that's entertaining from begining to end, and it doesn't make you feel bad (i.e. Suburbia).  I really hate Suburbia.  Don't go rent Suburbia.  Rent Empire Records.

title: MAYBE I'LL LIKE IT IN 10 YEARS
content: A friend of mine randomly let me borrow this movie and I'd heard a lot about it as if it was some kind of cult, ground-breaking movie, so I was quite looking forward to watching it. Instead i was disappointed. The first major problem was the acting, which was, lets say, CRAP, too energetic and a hint of Brady Bunch! Especially at the beginning when you see everyone arriving at work at the same time all hyped up and dancing around the store like they have nothing better to do with their lives. It made me sick! Who the hell enjoys going to work that much?The film opens with one of the newest members (i presume) closing the store for the first time all by himself. He's given some simple rules: count the cash twice and don't touch Joe's (manager) beer or cigars. But being a 'teenager' in 1995, rules are made to be broken. The little bugger takes the money to a Casino to try his luck after discovering Empire Records is to be bought out. In his favour he strikes a 7 and wins but then he gets cocky and tries for another go. Guess what? He fluffs it! And that kick starts the basis of the plot that doesn't actually take off until halfway through the film. In between this we are introduced to the individual characters such as a couple of typical stoner metal-heads, the pretty-boy with a crush, the pure virgin, an attention-seeking little cow who has the world on her shoulders and symbolizes her anger by shaving her head and showing off a bandage on her wrist where she attempted suicide. DAMN RENEE ZELLWEGER'S POUTING LIPS! sorry.I can't really think what else there is to say about this film. It made me laugh a couple of times admittedley and i felt happy afterwards no matter how discussted i was by it. Maybe i did like it... no no no! It is crap!

title: Power to the Youth of Small-Town America!
content: I loved this movie, and enjoy it every time I watch it.  The cast is sensational, especially Liv Tyler, as the perfect all-A honor student.  She lights up the screen as always, and keeps the story going throughout the entire movie.  It represents a little piece of pop-culture that I like to experience, and the soundtrack is wonderful.  I recommend this movie to anyone wanting to have a good time.

title: Awesome Movie !
content: I think that this was one of the most fun movies I've seen! I mean it has something for everyone. It's fun, romantic, hilarious, dramatic, and just everything ! I love the part where Lucas is dancing, it cracks me up every time !

title: A fun romantic comedy about saving a record store.
content: This movie totally rocks.  It is in my top ten. I recommend it to everyone who likes fun romantic comedies. Ethan Embry and Liv Tyler are in it and they are both hotties!!!  Renee Zellweger is extremely funny in this movie. I could probably recite every one of her lines.  Just remember, Damn the Man, Save the Empire!

The rest of the movie was equallycharming. What I loved about this film is that you don't expect it to beanything. So often am I disappointed when I have high expectations offilms and they're a total let down, but Empire Records was one of thosethat I never expected anything from but really delivered.I felt the cast was a real ensemble similar to friends or cheers whereevery charactor is unique in their own way each bringing an importantpart of themselves to the story. If you've seen this movie I think you'll agree with methat it is a simple, and charming little story with great charactors,dialogue and humor. If you have

title: Cliched characters held me away.
content: A friend of mine recommended that I watch this film so me and some other mates watched it.  I thought this was a bad movie and I wasn't going to write in about it but today I decided to check out other people's views. One person seemed to get it - LawnBoy 4 - but everybody else seemed to think it was some wonderful teenage rebellion movie.  I like a lot of teenage rebellion movies, Pump Up The Volume being one of my favs - by the same director, but I want to relate to the characters, or if not at least see some quality acting and direction.  In my opinion if you are going to introduce a straight A, Harvard-bound character who then turns 180 degrees to be revealed as a speed freak who throws herself at teen idols, then I would try to treat her with a little bit of understated reality based direction, try to make such a huge turn around seem possible.  These characters, especially Warren, got on my nerves.  The only people that I could relate them to are other characters from other similarly cliched films or even comic books.  Empire Records is a bad movie.  I think it is time someone made a true nineties teenage rebellion flick, dark, honest and real.

title: A funny, enjoyable, (not mentally taxing, but what the hell) movie.
content: Empire Records chronicles a group of misfit teenagers who all work in a music store.  For the most part the characters are original and funny, and so is the plot.There are a few problems with the movie, mainly due to Hollywood attempts to add drama, which more or less fall flat.  Aside from that, its a good watch. Not as good as Can't Hardly Wait, but still great fun.The character of Lucas is brilliant, summoning superb one liners, and all the characters are crisp, with dialogue that sounds spoken rather than rehearsed, (for the most part)Part of the humour from me is that I KNOW people who are scarily close to these characters, but that may just be me.The music is good, the acting is perfectly good, the script is fun, and aside from the blatant Hollywood 'insert drama here' moments, all is well.See this film.

title: Pitch Perfect
content: Empire Records is a gem among teen flicks for two reasons: cast and direction.First the cast - a real ensemble of actors with real credits and, in the case of the youngsters, real futures.  It took about five movies each before Liv Tyler or Renee Zellweger gave as much as they give in Empire!  Robin Tunney doesn't just appear in the movie with a shaved head - she cuts her hair on screen.  (You realize they had exactly one take.)  The kids interact believably and movingly.  LaPaglia and Cochrane are the anchors.  By the time the movie is over, you have a real sense of who Joe is, and if you're older than a teen, you probably know someone like him.The direction (and some of the writing) is deft.  Two or three things are usually happening at once, and are timed to peak in satisfying sequence.All of this sounds normal for a good quality grownup movie, but it is *so exceptional* for a "teen flick."  That's why Empire Records is a gem.This movie would make a great double bill with High Fidelity.

title: Empire Of Duds!!!

title: Simple and beautiful...
content: This may not be the deepest movie, but it's still very entertaining. It's a sweet and funny story! The actors are great, and I would like to tribute Renee Zellweger. Splendid job. Once again she proves what a beautiful person she is in the way she interprets her characters. We love you Renee!

title: One of the Best Teen Movies
content: Of all the teen crap the 90´s has producing, some of them are good, like Can´t Hardly Wait, Dazed and Confused and Empire Records. The soundtrack was inspiring, the characters were strong and with personality, and weren´t THAT stereotyped as in most teen films. I saw this one on HBO, and I expected it to be a major crap, but I found myself driven into a fun story and a movie that will tell future generations what was like the youth of the 90´s.

title: Slightly different slacker film
content: This is a classic slacker film, but it is slightly different from other movies of the genre. Its unique fantasy sequences and fast pace separate it from the likes of "Reality Bites", "The Breakfast Club", "Suburbia", etc. The characters are memorable and, better yet, quotable. The chemistry between this group of actors makes the film special, especially the father-like relationship Manager Joe has with his troubled employees. One of the best films of the 90's.

title: Fun feel-good movie
content: Brilliant really made us laugh. Wicked soundtrack. Ok maybe not such a hot plot or storyline BUT WHO CARE's!. It's entertaining and funny and brightened up a sunday afternoon. Worth seeing just for Max Caulfields extremely cheesy performance and bad hair!

title: yeah, it's bad, that's why it's good!
content: Empire Records came out when I was a freshman or sophomore in high school, and I remember thinking it was just the berries.  My friends and I would watch it almost every weekend, while smoking cigarettes and drinking mad dog.  The soundtrack and the film make me nostalgic, so maybe I am biased, but this is totally a great guilty pleasure movie.  It's bad, yes. But that's why it's so good!  People who are seeing it today as youngish-teenagers may think it's sooo dated, and it is (Liv Tyler's belly shirt and plaid kilt?  Please.), but for people in their young 20s, it's totally a great movie to rent with your friends.  Plus the soundtrack is pretty cool too in that mid-90s kind of way.
